theme_rationale: Dark mode is preferred for enterprise dashboards to reduce eye strain during long sessions, enhance focus on data visualizations, and project sophistication. Light mode toggle available for user preference and printing needs.

core_principles: Data clarity over decoration - every visual element serves a functional purpose
Luxury minimalism - sophisticated restraint with premium materials (subtle gradients, refined typography, elegant spacing)
Multi-brand harmony - unified system that respects individual brand identities
Density with breathing room - information-rich but never cramped
Saudi market sophistication - blend of modern tech aesthetics with cultural elegance
design_philosophy.emotional_tone: Professional authority with understated luxury - confident, precise, trustworthy, and refined
design_philosophy.visual_mood: Sophisticated command center with jewel-toned accents and architectural precision

color_system.archetype_rationale: Combines the premium depth of jewel tones (fitting for luxury Abaya and Atelier brands) with the functional clarity of Swiss design (essential for data-heavy enterprise dashboards). This hybrid approach ensures both sophistication and usability.

contrast_requirements.critical_rule: ALL text must meet WCAG AA standards (4.5:1 for normal text, 3:1 for large text 18px+)

contrast_requirements.focus_states: Must have HIGHER contrast than default state with visible focus ring
contrast_requirements.text_over_images: Use text-shadow or gradient overlays to ensure readability

typography.font_pairing_rationale: Combines classic serif elegance (fitting for luxury brands) with modern geometric sans-serif (essential for data clarity). This creates a sophisticated yet functional hierarchy.

spacing_system.philosophy: Generous spacing creates luxury and improves data scanability. Use 2-3x more spacing than typical dashboards.

cards.description: Generous internal padding prevents text collision with borders

sections.description: Large vertical spacing between major sections

tables.description: Comfortable cell spacing for data scanning

critical_rules.mobile_spacing: Reduce spacing by 25-30% on mobile (use responsive classes)

layout_system.grid_rationale: Data-heavy enterprise dashboards require efficient space utilization while maintaining scanability. Every pixel serves a purpose.

dashboard_grid.description: Tight, efficient grid for maximum data density

design_principles: Clarity over cleverness - users should never be confused

Performance - fast load times, optimistic updates, efficient rendering

critical_rules: NEVER center-align the app container - do not add text-align: center to .App in App.css
NEVER use transition: all - always specify properties (transform, opacity, colors, shadow)
NEVER use emoji characters for icons - always use Lucide React components
ALWAYS add data-testid attributes to interactive and key informational elements
ALWAYS explicitly set both background AND text color on hover states
ALWAYS ensure text meets WCAG AA contrast standards (4.5:1 for normal text)
ALWAYS use Shadcn components for forms, dialogs, dropdowns - customize styling heavily
NEVER use Shadcn Card component for dashboard layouts - build custom with raw divs
ALWAYS use generous spacing (2-3x more than typical) - luxury requires breathing room

implementation_sequence: 1. Update /app/frontend/src/index.css with new color system (CSS custom properties)
2. Update /app/frontend/tailwind.config.js with custom fonts and extended colors
3. Add Google Fonts links to index.html for Playfair Display, Manrope, IBM Plex Sans, IBM Plex Mono
4. Create theme context for dark/light mode toggle and brand selection
5. Build core layout components (Sidebar, Header, MainContent)
6. Build reusable dashboard components (KPICard, ChartContainer, DataTable)
8. Implement main dashboard with brand switcher and key metrics
10. Implement analytics page with charts and visualizations
11. Add loading states, error handling, and empty states throughout
12. Test responsive design on mobile, tablet, desktop
13. Test accessibility (keyboard navigation, screen readers, color contrast)
14. Optimize performance (lazy loading, code splitting, image optimization)

DO NOT forget hover states - every interactive element needs feedback
